questions.question: In a perfectly competitive market, how many buyers and sellers are there?
What is the main characteristic of a monopoly?
In a monopolistically competitive market, what is the main goal of firms?
What is the main difference between perfect competition and monopolistic competition?

answers.c: Level of entry and exit barriers

questions.question: In an oligopoly, what is the main form of competition among firms?
What is the kinked demand curve theory in oligopoly?

answers.a: Firms will always lower their prices to gain market share
answers.b: Firms will always raise their prices to maximize profits
answers.c: Firms will maintain their prices due to fear of retaliation from competitors
answers.d: Firms will always enter into cartel agreements

questions.question: What is the main objective of the Competition Commission of India?

answers.b: To regulate competition and protect consumer interests

answers.a: A pricing strategy where a firm sets a high price to maximize profits
answers.b: A pricing strategy where a firm sets a low price to drive out competitors
answers.c: A pricing strategy where a firm sets a price equal to its marginal cost
answers.d: A pricing strategy where a firm sets a price equal to its average revenue

questions.question: What is the difference between penetration pricing and skimming pricing?

answers.a: Penetration pricing is used to maximize profits, while skimming pricing is used to minimize costs
answers.b: Penetration pricing is used to enter a new market with a low price, while skimming pricing is used to maximize profits with a high price
answers.c: Penetration pricing is used to maximize costs, while skimming pricing is used to minimize profits
answers.d: Penetration pricing is used to minimize profits, while skimming pricing is used to maximize costs

questions.question: What is the main characteristic of a natural monopoly?

answers.a: High entry barriers and high fixed costs
answers.b: Low entry barriers and low fixed costs
answers.c: A single firm that produces a unique product
answers.d: A market with many buyers and sellers
